newsitem.title: JAPAN: GOLF-SUZUKI WINS THROUGH TO JAPAN CHAMPIONSHIP SECOND ROUND.
newsitem.headline: GOLF-SUZUKI WINS THROUGH TO JAPAN CHAMPIONSHIP SECOND ROUND.

text.p: Toru Suzuki had three eagles in the Japanese qualifying tournament for the world championship of golf on Saturday to take a two-up first-round victory over Shigeki Maruyama.
Hidemichi Tanaka went through to the second round of the 68-million-yen ($570,000) match play tournament by knocking out Masanobu Kimura.
Suzuki, 25th on the Japan PGA's money rankings with one win last year, started well when his 151-yard second shot on the par-four first hole at the Golden Palm Country Club went in.
Suzuki followed up with eagles on the par-five fourth and seventh holes and held on for the win over Maruyama.
Hajime Meshiai beat defending champion Hisayuki Sasaki one-up and Kazuhiko Hosokawa, number four on the JPGA's money ranking list last year, defeated Masahiro Kuramoto two and one.
In Sunday's semifinals, Suzuki will be paired with Meshiai and Tanaka will take on Hosokawa.
The winner will advance to the final in the United States, where representatives from four regions around the world will vie for the $1 million top prize.
